summary: The Specialist Joey Lenz Act of 2025 mandates changes to the periodic health assessments for members of the Armed Forces. Beginning in 2026, the Secretary of Defense must include annual sports physicals, electrocardiograms, and specific blood work, including a comprehensive metabolic panel, complete blood count, and potentially additional tests like thyroid stimulating hormone and brain natriuretic peptide tests. The bill also incorporates existing required tests and allows the Secretary to add other appropriate evaluations.
